[✓] Output the result in the required format Based on my comprehensive analysis, I have identified the most likely causal gene by matching the patient's phenotype profile with known gene-disease associations. The patient presents with multiple congenital anomalies, hypotonia, seizures, and systemic manifestations including hepatosplenomegaly, which directly matches the syndrome "Multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 2" associated with PIGA mutations. The other candidate genes do not explain the full spectrum of the patient's phenotypes: - GFI1 mainly causes neutropenia syndromes - NAA10 causes microphthalmia syndromes - TARDBP causes adult-onset neurodegenerative diseases - BRCA1 causes cancer syndromes - CHD1 causes Pilarowski-Bjornsson syndrome - PSAP causes lysosomal storage diseases typically affecting older children PIGA (ENSG00000165195) is the only gene that comprehensively explains the patient's constellation of neurological and systemic features consistent with Multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 2. <solution> {'causal_gene': ['ENSG00000165195']} </solution>
